meanings.definition: To make kosher by following Jewish dietary laws.
meanings.sent1: My mom is kashering the kitchen for Passover.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi will kasher the new dishes before using them.
meanings.sent3: I tried kashering my lunch, but it still didn't taste right.
meanings.sent4: She kashered her diet, only eating foods that met the kosher standards.
meanings.sent5: The family gathered to watch the special ceremony of kashering the pots and pans.

meanings.definition: The process of preparing utensils for kosher use.
meanings.sent1: Kashering is important to ensure the dishes are suitable for the holiday meal.
meanings.sent2: The kashering of the kitchen took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret weapon was his special kashering technique.
meanings.sent4: The tradition of kashering has been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling clean pots underwent the kashering process to be ready for the feast.
